text:
Anti-Trump Patriots fans find a charitable way to feel better about rooting on their team Anti-Trump Patriots fans find a charitable way to feel better about rooting on their team By Charles Curtis February 4, 2017 3:30 pm Follow @bycharlescurtis 658 shares By: Charles Curtis | February 4, 2017 3:30 pm Follow @bycharlescurtis 
Some New England Patriots fans who don’t agree with the politics of our current President might feel weird about rooting on a franchise with some ties to Donald Trump — head coach Bill Belichick , QB Tom Brady and owner Robert Kraft are all friends or supporters of POTUS. 
One of those Pats die-hards is Josh Gondelman, a comedian and writer at HBO’s Last Week Tonight : I'd like to be able to cheer for the team I grew up loving without cheerleading the Trump administration. Is this anyone else? 
— Josh Gondelman (@joshgondelman) February 3, 2017 
His solution? To donate money to causes he thinks are worthy when the Patriots score: Because of Tom Brady's garbage politics, I'm donating $100 for every Patriots TD and $50 for every FG to the @NAACP_LDF . #AGoodGame 
— Josh Gondelman (@joshgondelman) February 3, 2017 
It looks like #AGoodGame has caught on: As somebody without a rooting interest, I’m going to donate $30 for every non-scoring drive to @NILC_org . #AGoodGame 
— Bill Barnwell (@billbarnwell) February 4, 2017 Donating $5 for @Patriots field goals and $10 for @Patriots touchdowns to a woman campaigning for office. Thanks @joshgondelman ! #AGoodGame 
— Tanya Lundberg (@ILAH17_GoBlue) February 4, 2017 I am a lifelong Patriots fan. I feel morally compromised – always have. Will donate $10/TD and $5/FG to @DesisRisingUp . #AGoodGame 
— Chase Strangio (@chasestrangio) February 4, 2017 
Gondelman did clarify his statements about Brady’s politics later. Via Boston Magazine : 
He also notes, by the way, that calling Tom Brady’s politics “garbage” might have been “hyperbolic.” 
He clarified: “What I mean, in the cold harsh light of day, is that I wish he would engage more critically with politics given his well-documented terrible choice in red hats.” More!
